member.name: T:OscLib.OscPacket
member.summary: Represents a packet of OSC data serialized into bytes.
member.remarks: The basic purpose of this struct is to clearly designate a byte array as containing OSC binary data. Nothing more, nothing less - if a byte array is inside this struct, it should be safe to use with anything OSC-related. IOscPacket interface can be used to create custom packets, should extra functionality be needed.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscPacket.Size
member.summary: The number of bytes contained in this Packet.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscPacket.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Provides indexer access to binary data inside this packet.
member.remarks: This should help avoid accidents with overwriting bytes in the supposedly "read-only" byte array. The whole array can still be retrieved via the appropriate method, just in case it's needed.
member.param: Byte index.
member.returns: One byte of data present at the specified index, or 0 if the index is out of bounds.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscPacket.#ctor(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Creates a new OSC Packet out of the provided byte array containing OSC data (hopefully).
member.param: Should contain valid OSC binary data.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscPacket.GetContents
member.summary: Retrieves the byte array containing OSC data from this packet.
member.remarks: Despite being read-only, one can still change individual values inside this array. This can be both good and bad - and definitely something to be wary of. If this behaviour is not explicitly needed, it's probably safer to use the indexer access instead.

member.summary: Contains common constants, values and symbols, as well as pattern-matching and data-validation functionality as defined by the Open Sound Control Protocol specification.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Chunk32
member.summary: Length in bytes of a single (32 bits/4 bytes long) OSC data chunk.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Chunk64
member.summary: Length in bytes of a double-sized (64 bits/8 bytes long) OSC data chunk.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchAnySequence
member.summary: Stands for any sequence of zero or more characters in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchAnyChar
member.summary: Stands for any single character in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchCharArrayOpen
member.summary: Opens an array of characters in pattern matching. A match will occur if any of the characters within the array corresponds to a single character.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchCharArrayClose
member.summary: Closes an array of characters in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchNot
member.summary: "Reverses" the character array, matching it with any symbol *not* present in it.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchRange
member.summary: A range symbol used inside character arrays. Stands for the entire range of ASCII symbols between the two around it.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchStringArrayOpen
member.summary: Opens an array of strings in pattern matching. A match will occur if any of the strings within the array matches to a sequence of characters.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.MatchStringArrayClose
member.summary: Closes an array of strings in pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.BundleMarker
member.summary: Designates the start of an OSC Bundle.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Separator
member.summary: Separates parts of an address string inside OSC Messages. Always should be present at the start of an address string.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Comma
member.summary: Designates the beginning of an OSC type tag string inside messages. Separates strings in string arrays when pattern matching.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscProtocol.Space
member.summary: Personal space. Not allowed in OSC Method or Container names, otherwise insignificant.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscProtocol.PatternMatch(OscLib.OscString,OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Compares a string to the specified pattern, returns whether they match or not.
member.remarks: If the string in question is a pattern itself, this method will return "false" unless the patterns are identical.
member.param: The pattern to which the string is compared.
member.returns: "True" if string matches the pattern, "false" if not (duh).
member.exception: Thrown when either the curly brackets or the square brackets in the pattern aren't closed.

member.summary: Manages timekeeping and timetags. Provides the GlobalTick, based on the .Net DateTime and Stopwatch ticks - the main source of timing data for the rest of this library's components.
member.remarks: By default, uses the current UTC time as provided by the system. Can be reconfigured to start the count from any point in time after the beginning of the current NTP epoch (the lowest possible value for an OSC timetag, seeing as they are NTP-based).

member.name: T:OscLib.OscConverter
member.summary: Implements a set methods allowing for converting messages and bundles into OSC byte data and back.
member.remarks: This base class implements methods for converting OSC Messages and Bundles to OSC Packets and vice versa, but implementing the exact methods for serializing and deserializing arguments is left to derived classes. Different applications utilising OSC might have slightly different implementations of the OSC protocol -- some don't use double-length floats, some use an integer equal to 1 or 0 instead of T and F typetags for sending booleans, some use custom typetags, and so on. Some applications don't even allow any arguments apart from the bare standard int32, float32, OSC-string and OSC-blob. All this can be accounted for in method overloads in the derived classes.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscConverter._addEmptyTypeTagStrings
member.summary: Controls whether this version of OSC Protocol demands adding an empty type tag string (that is, a comma followed by three null bytes) to a message that doesn't contain any arguments.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscConverter._supportsArgumentArrays
member.summary: Controls whether this version of OSC Protocol supports argument arrays, designated by square bracket symbols in the type tag string.
member.remarks: If set to "False", any arrays found in outgoing messages' arguments will be "flattened" - that is, all arguments contained inside arrays will be added linearly. Argument arrays in incoming messages will similarly be "flattened" - the arguments themselves stay, the encompassing arrays are removed.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscConverter.AddEmptyTypeTagStrings
member.summary: Controls whether this version of OSC Protocol demands adding an empty type tag string (that is, a comma followed by three null bytes) to a message that doesn't contain any arguments.

Argument arrays in incoming messages will similarly be "flattened" - the arguments themselves stay, the encompassing arrays are removed.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscAddressSpace.AddElementAndPerform(OscLib.OscString[],System.Func{OscLib.OscAddressElement,OscLib.OscAddressElement})
member.summary: Adds an element to the provided address (adding containers as needed if need be) and does stuff to it, all via the provided function.
member.param: An array of OSC Address Element names that make up an address pattern. The last name will be that of the target element.

This function will be performed when the method reaches the final container and assesses whether it contains the target element. One of the following two things will happen at this point (the function should be able to tell which of these two scenarios is occuring by the fact that it will be passed a null in the second one):
1. If that container does contain the element with the target name, the function will take it as an argument and will Do Stuff to it.
2. If that container doesn't contain the element, the function will create a new element, then Do Stuff to it, then add it to the container.
If the function wass unsuccessful in its performance, it should return a null itself.
member.exception: Thrown when one of element names contains special symbols.
Thrown when there is a non-container element in the address path - that is, attempting to add elements to a non-container element.
member.returns: The element it added, or null if it was unsuccessful.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.SendToTarget``1(``0,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sends a *part* of the provided OSC Packet to the target end point of this OSC Link.
member.remarks: This method is useful when the packet contains rubbish/nulls at the end of it - for example, this can happen when using cache arrays to concatinate multiple packets into one bundle. This helps to avoid copying data to a new array in order to truncate it, which in turn avoids creating unnecessary GC pressure. Obviously, this method is *to be used with caution* - there are all sorts of bugs and weird edge cases that might crop up, and it's much safer to use isolated, non-cache arrays in general.
member.typeparam: The packet should implement the IOscPacket interface.
member.param: OSC Packet to be sent.
The length of useful data within the packet (in bytes) starting from the beginning of the packet. Everything outside this length will be discarded.
member.exception: Thrown if OSC link is not in target mode.
Thrown if trying to send null instead of binary data.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscSender`1
member.summary: Collects OSC Packets and sends them out through the provided OSC Link according to their priority. May bundle packets if configured to do so. May check packets against specified criteria, delaying sending them out or outright removing them if needed.
member.remarks:
The function of this component is twofold:
-- One, it allows to automatically bundle outgoing packets, which may be more performant than sending them separately. This can be useful when dealing with large quantities of small packets, for example.
-- Two, it allows controlling the outflow of packets according to specified parameters and changes in state. For example, delaying "/playNote" messages to an external synth until there's a confirmation that the synth is initialised.
To this end, OscSender implements two overridable methods that continously check the packets on the heap and decide whether they should be sent out, removed or left alone for now. There's also an overridable method providing
OSC Link needs to be in ToTarget mode when operating. Otherwise, nothing will get sent.
member.typeparam: The particular representation of an OSC packet used with this Sender. Should implement the IOscPacket interface.
